subject: PLDM:OEM: Handling the setNumericEffecterValue command
commitMessage:
PLDM:OEM: Handling the setNumericEffecterValue command

This commit handles the set numeric effecter value command
for the OEM types. This commit also handles the
DBus method call with the dumpType as SBE and the errorLogID
as the effecter value sent to set the numericEffecter.

Signed-off-by: Pavithra Barithaya <pavithra.b@ibm.com>
Change-Id: Ide14507e959ca0b24cbf8be67837355bdd895e19

Patch Set 12:

we cannot merge the libpldm code without unit tests, please add unit tests.

do you also want to take the container Id as input ? 

you will not be able to find the correct effecter with just effecter id right ?

PLDM_OEM_IBM_SLOT_ENABLE_EFFECTER_STATE = 32773,
	PLDM_OEM_IBM_SLOT_ENABLE_SENSOR_STATE = 32774,

please change this to a different value.
changed it to 	PLDM_OEM_IBM_SBE_SEMANTIC_ID = 32775
change not needed.
attached to motherboard ? hardcoding this is a bad idea ..can you dynamically map it to Item.Board ?
this seems to be increasing in size, can you just come up with a single function to create all PDR's in just one function.
that does this mean ? does this signify any additional information ?
change the name of this function ? so that it does not look like the normalization code.
Done

need a better name

may be pldm_find_child_container_id()
Done

are these even required ?

all the children under a parent will have the same container id right ?
Ack

checking what it does, i am not sure if this should be a libpldm api, can't this be done in the host_pdr_handler itself ?

And also need unit tests for both of these functions if they needs to be in the libpldm and also should cover broader usecases.

I believe this API can be used in future when there is a need to change the container id of the effecters. Maybe it can be a libpldm API :)

And yes, I will write the unit tests and cover broader use cases
in c files, the practice is to have entity_type and entity_instance
need a better name for this function.
Done
Done
can we move this to oem ? or can we move this to oemPlatformHandler  ?does not seem like this would be standard API that could be leveraged  by any one in the community
why is it uint8_t* ?
the effecterValue is declared like this - https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/pldm/+/46860/11/libpldmresponder/platform.cpp#575 so i thought it is a uint8_t*. Is it wrong?
no need of container id ?
if key != effecterId, then the entityInstance will not be set..do you wanna throw error in that case ?
no error is needed I guess it can continue to set the numeric effecter with the value and instance number passed in the function.
duplicate var
Ack
too many magic numbers

yes, The dcmId is always at the 61th position in the entityPath string and we need the ascii value of he char so I subtracted 48.
It would be helpful if you know any other way of doing this and point me to that.
are you not supposed to check the objectpath returned ?
yes, it is done in the next commit above this.
do you need this to be public ?
Done
